Name: Matthew Skelton
AboutMe:
Matthew Skelton has been building, deploying, and operating commercial software systems since 1998, including systems for London Stock Exchange, TUI Travel, Virgin Mobile, thetrainline.com, and MRI brain scanning machines. He is Co-founder and Principal Consultant at Skelton Thatcher Consulting (http://skeltonthatcher.com/) where he specialises in Continuous Delivery, DevOps, aspects of ITIL, and software operability.

Matthew founded and runs the 1000-member London Continuous Delivery meetup group (http://londoncd.org.uk/), and instigated the first conference in Europe dedicated to Continuous Delivery, PIPELINE Conference (http://pipelineconf.info/). He is a regular presenter at conferences and co-facilitates the popular Experience DevOps workshop series (http://experiencedevops.org/) and Effective DevOps seminar series (http://effectivedevops.com/).

He is a Chartered Engineer (CEng) and a member of the British Computer Society (MBCS).

Matthew blogs at http://matthewskelton.net/ and is on Twitter at @matthewpskelton
